metadata.title: CVE-2021-3733 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
There's a flaw in urllib's AbstractBasicAuthHandler class. An attacker whocontrols a malicious HTTP server that an HTTP client (such as web browser)connects to, could trigger a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDOS)during an authentication request with a specially crafted payload that issent by the server to the client. The greatest threat that this flaw posesis to application availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.5 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
python3.4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11').
